scenes.title: Jake's Arrival on Pandora
scenes.summary: Jake Sully awakens from cryo-sleep after a five-year journey to Pandora. A paralyzed Marine in a wheelchair, he's replacing his deceased twin brother in the Avatar Program. First glimpses of the alien moon reveal floating mountains and bioluminescent forests. Colonel Quaritch delivers an intimidating briefing about the hostile environment and indigenous Na'vi people.
scenes.imagery: Blue moon of Pandora. Floating mountains. Hell's Gate fortress surrounded by hostile jungle.

scenes.title: Meeting Grace and the Avatar
scenes.summary: Jake meets Dr. Grace Augustine, who's hostile about his lack of scientific training. In the bio-lab, Jake sees his avatar for the first time—a ten-foot-tall blue Na'vi body with his features, floating in an amnio tank. Despite Grace's skepticism, Jake is mesmerized by the possibility of walking again.
scenes.imagery: Blue avatar floating in tank. Neural umbilical. Grace smoking in the link room.

scenes.title: First Link - Running Free
scenes.summary: Jake links with his avatar for the first time. Overwhelmed by sensation, he leaps from the gurney and runs outside—his first steps in five years. Grace and the medical team chase after him. Jake experiences pure joy, running barefoot through grass, feeling rain. This is freedom he thought he'd lost forever.
scenes.imagery: Jake bursting through doors. Running barefoot in rain. Medical team chasing. First taste of freedom.

scenes.title: First Sortie into Pandora
scenes.summary: The avatar team ventures into the jungle to collect samples. Jake experiences Pandora's wonders: massive trees, exotic plants, bizarre creatures. Grace warns him not to touch anything. The forest is alive with bioluminescence and danger. Every plant and animal is connected to Eywa through neural networks.
scenes.imagery: Towering trees. Helicoradians retracting when touched. Strange six-legged creatures.

scenes.title: Thanator Attack - Separated
scenes.summary: A massive thanator—Pandora's apex predator—attacks the team. In the chaos, Jake is separated and runs deeper into the jungle. The creature pursues him relentlessly. Jake leaps off a waterfall to escape, plunging into the river below. Night falls. He's alone in hostile territory with no weapons or communication.
scenes.imagery: Black panther-like predator. Armored scales. Jake leaping off waterfall into darkness.

scenes.title: Viperwolf Pack - Neytiri Saves Jake
scenes.summary: Lost at night, Jake is attacked by a pack of viperwolves—six-legged predators with bioluminescent markings. He fights desperately with a makeshift torch. Suddenly, a Na'vi warrior appears—Neytiri—killing the wolves with bow and arrows. She's angry at Jake for the unnecessary deaths: he brought danger to himself through ignorance.
scenes.imagery: Snarling viperwolves with glowing stripes. Neytiri's arrows finding marks. Bioluminescent forest.

scenes.title: Woodsprites Choose Jake
scenes.summary: Neytiri is about to leave Jake to his fate when sacred atokirina—pure white woodsprites—descend upon him, landing on his arms and body. Dozens of them. This is a sign from Eywa. Neytiri's anger transforms to wonder. She decides to bring him to Hometree instead of abandoning him. The spirits have chosen this alien.
scenes.imagery: Glowing white seedpods descending like snow. Covering Jake's arms. Neytiri kneeling in respect.

scenes.title: Quaritch's Offer
scenes.summary: Jake reports to Quaritch about his night in the forest. The Colonel sees opportunity: Jake has made contact with the Na'vi. Quaritch offers a deal—if Jake provides intel about the natives and how to force them from Hometree, he'll get Jake's legs back with spine surgery. Jake is tempted by the possibility of truly walking again.
scenes.imagery: Colonel's scarred face. Holographic display of Hometree. Jake's wheelchair.

scenes.title: Jake Arrives at Hometree
scenes.summary: Neytiri brings Jake to the massive Hometree, home of the Omaticaya clan. Hundreds of Na'vi stare at the alien intruder. Mo'at, the Tsahik (spiritual leader), and Eytukan, the clan leader, debate killing him. The woodsprites were a sign, but Jake is one of the 'Sky People' destroying their world. Mo'at decides: Neytiri must teach him their ways.
scenes.imagery: Massive tree with spiral interior. Hundreds of blue faces staring. Mo'at's stern judgment.

scenes.title: First Lessons with Neytiri
scenes.summary: Neytiri teaches Jake the Na'vi way: their language, how to see the forest's connections, to move silently, to respect all life. Jake is clumsy, constantly making mistakes. She corrects him with both patience and frustration. He begins to understand that everything is connected through Eywa—the trees, animals, and Na'vi are all part of one living network.
scenes.imagery: Jake stumbling through forest. Neytiri demonstrating silent movement. Neural connections explained.

scenes.title: Jake's Video Logs - Double Agent
scenes.summary: Jake records video logs documenting his experiences with the Na'vi. Initially, his reports are tactical—describing Hometree's structure, clan numbers, weaknesses. But his tone gradually shifts. He's becoming fascinated by Na'vi culture, their philosophy. Grace notices the change. He's starting to see through Na'vi eyes, not just reporting intelligence.
scenes.imagery: Jake speaking to camera. His expression changing over time. Grace watching concerned.

scenes.title: Taming the Pa'li (Direhorse)
scenes.summary: Jake must tame and bond with a pa'li (direhorse). The six-legged creature throws him repeatedly. Tsu'tey mocks him. Finally, Jake makes the neural connection—tsaheylu—linking his queue to the animal. They become one. Jake experiences the profound bond the Na'vi share with nature. This is the first step to becoming a hunter.
scenes.imagery: Six-legged direhorse bucking. Jake's queue connecting. Sudden calm as they bond.

scenes.title: Floating Mountains
scenes.summary: Neytiri takes Jake to the Hallelujah Mountains—floating islands of rock held aloft by unobtanium deposits. Jake is awestruck by the impossible beauty. Waterfalls cascade into clouds below. This sacred place houses the ikran (banshee) rookery. Here Jake will attempt his Iknimaya—the rite of passage to become a true hunter.
scenes.imagery: Mountains floating in sky. Magnetic rocks. Waterfalls disappearing into clouds.

scenes.title: Iknimaya - Choosing the Banshee
scenes.summary: Jake climbs the treacherous path to the banshee rookery. Dozens of ikran screech and dive. Neytiri explains: he doesn't choose his ikran—it chooses him by trying to kill him. A fierce orange and blue banshee attacks. Jake must bond with it or die. After a violent struggle on the cliff edge, he makes tsaheylu. They are bonded for life.
scenes.imagery: Screaming banshees diving. Jake wrestling creature on cliff edge. Neural connection.

scenes.title: First Flight
scenes.summary: Jake's first flight on his bonded ikran is chaos. They plummet through the clouds before Jake learns to sync with the creature's movements. Once connected, they soar together. He experiences the pure freedom of flight. Neytiri joins him, and they dive through waterfalls, race between floating mountains. Jake has never felt more alive.
scenes.imagery: Diving through clouds. Racing between floating islands. Jake whooping with joy.

scenes.title: Jake's First Kill
scenes.summary: Jake successfully hunts a hexapede. As the creature dies, Neytiri teaches him to see its spirit return to Eywa. All energy is borrowed, and death is simply returning that energy to the network. Jake begins to truly understand the Na'vi worldview—life, death, and rebirth are all part of Eywa's circle. He's becoming one of the People.
scenes.imagery: Dying hexapede. Prayer over the kill. Energy returning to Eywa.

scenes.title: Becoming Omaticaya
scenes.summary: After completing his trials, Jake undergoes the ritual to become one of the People. His human past is symbolically burned away. He's painted with clan markings and welcomed by Eytukan. Even Tsu'tey accepts him. Jake is no longer an outsider—he's Omaticaya. The clan celebrates with song and dance. Jake belongs.
scenes.imagery: Ritual fire. Painted markings. Dancing celebration. Jake finally belonging.

scenes.title: Mating at Tree of Voices
scenes.summary: Neytiri leads Jake to the Tree of Voices, a sacred willow grove where the Na'vi connect with their ancestors. Bioluminescent tendrils hang from branches. She reveals she was to mate with Tsu'tey, but Eywa has chosen differently. Jake and Neytiri make tsaheylu, bonding before Eywa. They mate for life under the sacred tree.
scenes.imagery: Glowing willow tendrils. Bioluminescent grove. Jake and Neytiri bonding.

scenes.title: Which World is Real?
scenes.summary: Jake wakes in the link room after spending the night with Neytiri. His human body feels alien now—weak, broken, wrong. He rushes back to his avatar. Grace confronts him: he's crossed a line. Jake's loyalty is shifting. He admits he doesn't know which world is real anymore. Is he Jake dreaming he's Na'vi, or Na'vi dreaming he's human?
scenes.imagery: Jake staring at his human legs. Rushing back to link. Two worlds pulling him apart.

scenes.title: Selfridge's Ultimatum
scenes.summary: Administrator Selfridge grows impatient. The richest unobtanium deposit lies beneath Hometree. He gives Jake one final chance to convince the Na'vi to relocate peacefully. Otherwise, Quaritch will use force. Jake promises to try, knowing it's impossible. The Na'vi will never leave their sacred home. War is inevitable.
scenes.imagery: Hologram showing unobtanium beneath Hometree. Selfridge's golf balls. Quaritch's weapons.

scenes.title: Attempting Diplomacy
scenes.summary: Jake tries to explain to Eytukan and the clan that they must leave Hometree. The humans will destroy it for the rocks beneath. The Na'vi are horrified and enraged. Tsu'tey demands to know if Jake is a spy. The trust Jake built crumbles. Mo'at sees the truth in his eyes—he's been working for the enemy all along.
scenes.imagery: Clan's angry faces. Neytiri's devastated expression. Jake's guilt.

scenes.title: Grace's Research - Neural Networks
scenes.summary: Grace explains her research to Jake: the trees of Pandora form a planet-wide neural network. More connections than a human brain. Eywa isn't just myth—it's a biological consciousness. The Na'vi can upload and download memories and experiences. The forest is literally alive and aware. This changes everything.
scenes.imagery: Holographic neural networks. Tree roots connecting. Synapses firing.

scenes.title: Eywa's Network - Tsaheylu with Tree
scenes.summary: Jake connects his queue to the Tree of Voices. Through tsaheylu, he hears the voices of ancestors, feels the memories of past hunters, experiences the collective consciousness of the People. This is Eywa—not a god, but a living network of all life. Every Na'vi who has ever lived continues within this web. Death is not the end.
scenes.imagery: Glowing tendrils. Jake's eyes wide. Voices and memories flowing.

scenes.title: Bulldozers Attack Tree of Voices
scenes.summary: Jake's intelligence led the RDA to this location. Massive bulldozers tear through the sacred grove. Na'vi warriors attack with bows and arrows, but bullets cut them down. Jake tries to stop the destruction from both sides. The Tree of Voices is obliterated. Neytiri sees Jake for what he is—betrayer. His deception has destroyed their sacred site.
scenes.imagery: Bulldozer blades tearing through willows. Bodies falling. Tree collapsing. Neytiri's rage.

scenes.title: Jake Expelled from Clan
scenes.summary: Jake and Grace are bound and brought before the clan. Jake's video logs have been discovered—proof he was a spy. Tsu'tey wants him executed. Neytiri won't speak for him. Eytukan orders them expelled: never return. Jake tries to explain, but Neytiri cuts her bond with him. She calls him nothing. He's lost everything.
scenes.imagery: Jake and Grace bound. Video logs playing. Neytiri turning away. Expulsion from Hometree.

scenes.title: Quaritch Orders Attack
scenes.summary: With diplomacy failed, Quaritch launches the assault. Gunships and soldiers mobilize. Selfridge has authorized lethal force. They'll destroy Hometree and forcibly relocate the Na'vi. Jake and Grace are locked up—they're liabilities now. Grace tries to warn Mo'at but communications are jammed. The military machine rolls toward Hometree.
scenes.imagery: Gunships launching. Soldiers arming. Jake pounding on door. Quaritch's scarred face.

scenes.title: Gas Attack on Hometree
scenes.summary: Gunships surround Hometree and fire gas grenades. The Na'vi flee choking from the toxic smoke. Warriors fire arrows—useless against armored ships. Quaritch issues the ultimatum: evacuate or be destroyed. The Na'vi refuse to abandon their home. Quaritch gives the order. Missiles slam into the base of the massive tree.
scenes.imagery: Gas clouds billowing. Arrows bouncing off metal. Missiles striking tree base.

scenes.title: Hometree Falls - Eytukan Dies
scenes.summary: The mighty Hometree crashes down in flames. Hundreds of Na'vi flee as their home collapses. Eytukan is crushed by falling debris. Neytiri finds her father dying. Mo'at holds him as his spirit leaves. From Hell's Gate, Jake watches in horror on monitors—his intelligence caused this massacre. The Omaticaya people are broken, scattered, homeless.
scenes.imagery: Massive tree crashing. Smoke and fire. Eytukan dying. Survivors scattered.

scenes.title: Prison Break - Trudy's Choice
scenes.summary: Trudy Chacon and scientist Max stage a breakout. Trudy, a pilot, can't stomach the massacre. She breaks Jake, Grace, and Norm out of confinement. They steal an aircraft and escape under fire. Quaritch pursues but they reach the forest. Grace is shot during the escape, bleeding badly. They flee to the old Site 26 research station.
scenes.imagery: Aircraft escaping. Bullets flying. Grace bleeding. Forest sanctuary.

scenes.title: Taming Toruk - Last Shadow
scenes.summary: Jake remembers the legendary Toruk Macto—only five Na'vi have ever ridden the great leonopteryx. It appears in times of great sorrow to unite the clans. Jake leaps onto Toruk from above, bonding with the apex predator in a death-defying act. He becomes Toruk Macto. This is his only chance to regain the People's trust and lead them to war.
scenes.imagery: Massive red and black predator. Jake leaping from above. Bonding mid-flight.

scenes.title: Return as Toruk Macto
scenes.summary: Jake flies Toruk to the Well of Souls where the scattered clans have gathered. The Na'vi are in shock—Toruk Macto has returned. Tsu'tey recognizes the prophecy. Jake confesses everything: his betrayal, his transformation, his love for Neytiri and the People. He asks to fight beside them. The clans kneel. Even Neytiri softens. He's earned a second chance.
scenes.imagery: Toruk landing. Clans kneeling. Neytiri's tears. Jake's humility.

scenes.title: Gathering the Clans
scenes.summary: As Toruk Macto, Jake rides to distant clans across Pandora—the horse clans of the plains, the Ikran people of the mountains. He speaks of the humans' destruction and calls them to war. One by one, clans answer. Thousands of warriors gather. Neytiri fights beside him. Tsu'tey becomes war chief. An army assembles for Pandora's defense.
scenes.imagery: Different clans arriving. War paint. Thousands of warriors. Preparations for battle.

scenes.title: Grace's Transfer Attempt
scenes.location: Well of Souls - Tree of Souls
scenes.summary: Grace is dying from her gunshot wound. Jake asks Mo'at to attempt a consciousness transfer—moving Grace permanently into her avatar through Eywa. The clan performs the ritual beneath the Tree of Souls. Grace connects with Eywa, experiencing the network's beauty. But her wound is too severe. She dies peacefully, saying she's with Eywa. She's home.
scenes.imagery: Massive willow tree. Glowing roots. Grace connecting. Peaceful death.

scenes.title: Jake's Prayer to Eywa
scenes.summary: Jake makes tsaheylu with the Tree of Souls for the first time. He prays to Eywa for help against the Sky People. Neytiri explains Eywa doesn't take sides—she only maintains balance. But Jake begs anyway: the People need help. The RDA will destroy everything. His prayer is desperate, heartfelt. Eywa is silent.
scenes.imagery: Jake connecting to massive tree. Glowing neural network. Silent forest.

scenes.title: Quaritch's Final Assault
scenes.summary: Quaritch arms the Dragon Gunship—a massive airborne fortress. The plan: fly to the Tree of Souls and drop incendiary bombs, destroying the Na'vi spiritual center and breaking their will. If the Na'vi want a war, they'll get extinction. Selfridge has lost control. Quaritch and his forces prepare for genocide. Nothing will stop them.
scenes.imagery: Massive gunship arming. Bombs loading. Soldiers boarding. Scarred colonel commanding.

scenes.title: The Great Battle Begins
scenes.summary: Thousands of Na'vi on ikran and Toruk meet the human gunships in aerial combat. Bows and spears versus missiles and machine guns. The Na'vi are outmatched but fierce. Trudy flies with them, attacking her former allies. Ground forces clash in the forest. Blood and fire. The Na'vi are being slaughtered despite their courage and numbers.
scenes.imagery: Thousands of ikran attacking gunships. Explosions. Warriors falling. Forest burning.

scenes.title: Trudy's Sacrifice
scenes.summary: Trudy attacks the Dragon Gunship with her smaller aircraft, trying to take down Quaritch. She scores hits but is overwhelmed by superior firepower. Quaritch personally shoots her down. Her aircraft explodes in a fireball. Norm watches his friend die from the ground. Her sacrifice buys precious time but the battle is still lost.
scenes.imagery: Small aircraft attacking massive gunship. Explosion. Fireball falling.

scenes.title: Tsu'tey Falls
scenes.summary: Tsu'tey leads warriors boarding the Dragon Gunship. They fight hand-to-hand with soldiers. Tsu'tey is shot multiple times but keeps fighting. A soldier severs his queue—his neural connection. He falls from the ship. Jake finds him dying on the forest floor. Tsu'tey names Jake the new Olo'eyktan. He asks for a clean death. Jake gives it.
scenes.imagery: Warriors on gunship. Queue being severed. Tsu'tey falling. Jake's mercy.

scenes.title: Eywa Intervenes - Animals Attack
scenes.summary: Suddenly, the forest erupts. Hammerhead titanotheres, viperwolves, thanators—every predator on Pandora charges from the trees, attacking human forces. Animals that never cooperate act as one army. Eywa heard Jake's prayer. She sent every creature to defend the balance. The tide turns. Na'vi warriors rally as Pandora itself joins the fight.
scenes.imagery: Massive animals charging. Thanators attacking soldiers. Forest coming alive.

scenes.title: Final Fight - Quaritch's Death - Jake's Transfer
scenes.summary: Quaritch in an AMP suit attacks the link shack, trying to kill Jake's human body. Neytiri fights him with bow and thanator. Quaritch smashes Jake's link pod—his human body is exposed to toxic air. Neytiri kills Quaritch with arrows, saving Jake. Later, beneath the Tree of Souls, Mo'at performs the consciousness transfer. Jake's human eyes close. His avatar eyes open—permanently. He's truly Na'vi now.
scenes.imagery: Giant mech suit. Neytiri's arrows. Link pod shattering. Tree of Souls glowing. Jake's eyes opening blue.
